intro: Solanum glabrum, commonly known as the smooth nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States. It typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters and features simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that bloom in summer, followed by berries that mature to a dark purple color. Solanum glabrum is part of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
